library.name: Core
library.description: The core library exposes some basic built-in language functionality. Unlike other libraries, the Core library does not need to be imported and is readily available from all files.

enum.name: Type
enum.description: Enum representing the various types in Crayon.

function.name: assert

arg.name: condition
arg.description: A boolean condition that must be true.

arg.name: message
arg.description: An optional error message to show when the assertion condition is false.

function.description: Generates an exception if the condition is false.

arg.name: message
arg.description: An error message to show in the exception.

function.name: chr
function.description: Converts a character code value (as a unicode point value) into a single-character string.

function.name: ord
function.returns: The character code value (as a unicode point value).
function.description: Converts a character value into its numerical unicode point value. If the string passed in has multiple characters, the first character is used.

function.name: currentTime
function.returns: The current time as a float
function.description: Returns the current unix time stamp as reported by the local machine. The unix time stamp is the number of seconds since midnight January 1st, 1970.

function.name: parseFloat

arg.name: value
arg.description: A floating point number as a string.

function.returns: The numerical value of the text or null if there's an error.
function.description: Converts a decimal (or integer) string into its actual numeric value. If the number depicted is an integer, the return value will still be a float (see parseInt). Surrounding whitespace is ignored. If the string does not depict a number, null is returned instead.

function.name: parseInt
function.returns: The integer value of the text as an integer type.
function.description: Converts an integer as a text string into the actual integer type. Surrounding whitespace is ignored. If the string does not depict an integer, null is returned. If the string is a floating point decimal, null is also returned (see parseFloat).

function.name: print

arg.name: value
arg.description: Item or message to display in standard output

function.description: Shows a message or value in the standard output. Standard output is generally in the same window as the command line for platforms that support this, however, the actual output may appear elsewhere depending on the platform (for example, the JavaScript console, or the Android Log).

function.name: sleep

arg.name: delay
arg.description: Number of seconds to pause execution

function.description: Pauses execution for some number of seconds. NOTE: for JavaScript-exported platforms, the underlying implementation uses a setTimeout rather than blocking the browser thread, so this is still safe to use in JavaScript without causing the browser to become unresponsive.

function.name: typeof
function.description: Determines which type the given value is.

function.name: isString

returns.description: True if the value is a string

function.description: Returns true if the given value is a string. This is semantically identical to typeof(value) == Core.Types.STRING.

function.name: isNumber

returns.description: True if the value is an integer or a float

function.description: Returns true if the given value is one of the numeric types (integer or float). This is semantically identical to typeof(value) == Core.Types.INTEGER || typeof(value) == Core.Types.FLOAT.

class.name: Exception
class.description: The root class of all exceptions.

function.name: (constructor)

arg.name: message
arg.description: Message to show in the exception

function.description: Instantiates a new exception. Optionally allows for setting a message and also another exception that caused this exception.

returns.description: The stack trace of this exception.

class.name: FatalException
class.description: An exception that cannot be caught. This is generated by the VM in situations where it cannot recover, such as stack overflows.

class.name: AssertionFailedException
class.description: Exception thrown by Core.assert() and Core.fail()

class.name: DivisionByZeroException
class.description: Generated when you divide or mod by 0.

class.name: IndexOutOfRangeException
class.description: Generated when you access an index in a list outside of its bounds.

class.name: InvalidArgumentException
class.description: General exception used when an argument to a function is wrong. The message field should contain specific information.

class.name: InvalidAssignmentException
class.description: Exception generated when you assign a value to an invalid target. For example, attempting to assign a value to a field that is already occupied by a function defined in code.

class.name: InvalidInvocationException
class.description: Generated when you attempt to invoke a non-function value like a function.

class.name: InvalidKeyException
class.description: Generated when you attempt to use a value for a dictionary key that is not an integer, object, or string.

class.name: InvalidOperationException
class.description: General-purpose exception for when something has been invoked incorrectly. The message should contain specific information.

class.name: KeyNotFoundException
class.description: Generated when you attempt to access a key in a dictionary that does not exist.

class.name: NotImplementedException
class.description: Useful exception to throw for when you want to mark a function as not having been implemented.

class.name: NullReferenceException
class.description: Thrown when null is accessed as though it is a non-null value.

class.name: UnassignedVariableException
class.description: Occurs when a variable is used before it has any value assigned to it.

class.name: UnknownFieldException
class.description: Occurs when you access a field on a value that does not exist.

class.name: UnsupportedOperationException
class.description: General purpose exception for when you attempt to use code in a way that it was not designed to support. Also thrown when you perform operations on types that do not have that combination of operations defined. For example, subtracting a list from a string.

function.name: getClassFromInstance
function.description: Gets a reference to the class of the given object.

function.name: getClasses

arg.name: commonBaseClass
arg.description: filters results to only classes that extend from this class

function.description: Gets a list of all class types in the project. Optionally, you can pass a filter argument to limit results down to only classes that implement that base class.

function.name: getMethods

arg.name: instanceOrClass
arg.description: instance or class to get methods from.

function.description: Gets a list of methods on an instance or class. For instances, only instance methods are returned. For classes, only static methods are returned.
